sentences.en: "You've got to try this, " he shouted to his wife, to the delight of a fawning saleswoman.
sentences.cn: “你来试试这个”，在销售员的奉承下，他喜出望外的朝他妻子喊道。

sentences.en: Contented, easily after, with few, simple in livelihood, prudent and modest, not fawning upon family.
sentences.cn: 知足 、 易供养, 少世俗务, 生活俭朴,诸根寂静, 谨慎和谦虚, 不攀求于俗家.

sentences.en: During his life Confucius loathed spineless, fawning sycophants, but he particularly phony gentlemen who appeared respectable.
sentences.cn: 孔子一生不耻没气节或巧言令色的小人, 但他尤其最痛恶与貌似恭谨的伪君子为伍.

sentences.en: Fawning authors penned books about his management techniques that remain on sale at bookstores here today.
sentences.cn: 吹捧的作家写的关于他的管理技巧的书仍然在书店畅销.

sentences.en: Full of or exhibiting servile compliance; fawning .
sentences.cn: 这辆运货马车装满了 蔬菜.

sentences.en: He fawning manner whenever the boss is around just makes me curl up.
sentences.cn: 每当老板在时,他那摇尾乞怜的样子真使我恶心.

sentences.en: He was fawning on a damsel with soft words.
sentences.cn: 他正用甜言蜜语向一位女郞献殷勤.

sentences.en: Nauseatingly fawning journalism that's all it is.
sentences.cn: 那只不过是以令人作呕的溜须拍马为能事的新闻报道。

sentences.en: Not a foreign policy of resisting Japan, but one of fawning on her.
sentences.cn: 不是抗日的外交, 而是媚日的外交.

sentences.en: Now, with the old man fawning on her, she puts on airs.
sentences.cn: 现在呢, 因为“老东西”——这是秀才的妻叫秀才的名字——趋奉了她, 就装着娇滴滴的样子了.

sentences.en: The game is played out in endless fawning speeches, flattering remarks and fake smiles.
sentences.cn: 于是 这个游戏中充斥着无穷无尽的恭维式讲话、奉承式言谈和虚伪的笑容。

sentences.en: The puppy was fawning oh his master.
sentences.cn: 小狗向它的主人摇尾乞怜.

sentences.en: The puppy was fawning on its master.
sentences.cn: 小狗朝着主人摇尾乞怜.

sentences.en: The servant worn a fawning smile.
sentences.cn: 仆人的脸上露出一种谄笑.

sentences.en: The tone was typical Chandler - half fawning, half insolent.
sentences.cn: 这是十足的钱德勒的口气 -- 又是阿谀奉承, 又是傲慢无理.

sentences.en: There were still some crafty and fawning ministers who followed Zhao Gao closely in ordinary times.
sentences.cn: 还有一些平时就紧跟赵高的奸佞之人立刻表示拥护赵高的说法,对皇上说,“这确是一匹千里马! ”

sentences.en: They were fawning on their rich uncle.

trans.tran_cn: （尤指狗等）跳过来往人身上蹭以示亲热( fawn的现在分词 )，巴结，讨好
